intro: Barbarea planisiliqua, commonly known as the broadleaf winter cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually lobed or toothed. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in waste areas. Barbarea planisiliqua is an annual or biennial herb that can be invasive in some regions.
